segments.text: You said you like classical music very much . Then who is your favorite opera star ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: There are three of them , the Three Tenors .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , you mean Pavarotti , Domingo and Carreras . Have you been to their live shows ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yeah , it's really a unique experience . It's a solo concert by Pavarotti . He put on the performance in the Forbidden City in Beijing .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I've heard of that one . It was also his swan song .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Besides , speaking of classical music , we should never forget about the New Year's Concert .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Of course not . People all over the world watch it on TV , or listen to it on the radio .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Sure . It's undoubtedly one of the biggest classical music events . Have you ever been to the live show ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , I went to the New Year's Concert in 2005 .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Wow , you are so lucky . I saw that one on TV . But it must be so different to be there in the concert hall .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That's for sure . You know , it's really amazing to be in the best concert hall , listening to the performance by the best orchestra . I had the greatest time ever .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Who was the conductor at that event ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Lorin Maazel . He did an amazing job . Moreover , he just celebrated his 75th birthday .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: So cool . I wish I can go to the live New Year's Concert someday in the future .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: The right opportunity for you would come along soon . You know , music is transnational .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I believe in that . Well , the performance is about to begin . Let's be quiet .
segments.speaker: S2
